intro: Chamaecrista delicata, commonly known as the delicate crownflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, papery leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a vibrant touch to its habitat. Its flowers are typically pea-shaped, a characteristic feature of the Fabaceae family, and attract various pollinators. Chamaecrista delicata is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
